p: We observed strong negative Spearman correlations between QE concentration and survival of E. albidus at 6 °C (r s = −0.9, p < 0.05; based on 350 worms) and at −1 °C (r s = −0.85, p < 0.05; based on 230 worms). This correlation was stronger than for slugs. In general, the survival of worms at 6 °C was significantly higher than survival at −1 °C (Kruskal–Wallis ANOVA: H (1) = 5.7, p = 0.02).
